result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin Robert Moser was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: No possession or use of firearms and other dangerous weapons;

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Probable Cause Found
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Amanda. 
Case called at 9:40 am. 
State appears by ADA Cody Marschall.  Defendant appears, and with Attorney Tom Roley. 

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.

Waiver of Prelim done at this time: Waiver of Prelim to be filed.  
Court questions Defendant as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.

COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information to be E-filed.  R/W; R/J. 

State moves to: 
Ct.1(Resisting or Obstructing an Officer/Repeater)>>DRI.

COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA to Ct.2(Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony[PTAC]/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST.

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty;

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 2 years probation; CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent. No contact with co-defendant.  No possession or use of firearms and other dangerous weapons.  Pay CC/DNA surcharge and provide sample. 

COURT grants 40 days credit. 

Adj: 9:49 am.
Final pre-trial on September 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.

ADA Cody Marschall appears in person; Atty Roley appears in person
DATES: 
FPT - 9/2/22 @ 9:30
Pre-trial conference on July 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.

No contact with victim(s): M.P.R. Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. No possession or use of ammunition or firearms or dangerous weapons. - No possession or use of ammunition or firearms or dangerous weapons. 

- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 2 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
